adviseScripts.text: When you're out on the battlefield,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: which do you think is more important, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Tried-and-true tactics or improvisation?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Tried-and-true tactics.
Improvisation.
That's one thing you and I agree on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I think it's vital to stick to the techniques that have been practiced beforehand.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Only then will the ship not veer too far off course.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'm the opposite.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I put all my faith in tactics that have already proven effective in the past.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Sure, improvising may be better for handling unexpected events, but...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: flying by the seat of your pants may bring about some dire consequences down the line.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I talk more in-depth about various ways of commanding on a battlefield.
Do you like seafood-flavored Splendamin, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text:
Octopus-flavored Splendamin. Halibut-flavored Splendamin. 
Things like that...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I like it.
Not really.
You like it too, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That's an outrage! Everyone around me seems to be crazy about that fishy and salty... Blech! They must think I'm weird for hating it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If you ask me, they're the ones who are weird.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Whew... That's a relief.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If you ended up liking that nasty stuff,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'd be the only one who isn't obsessing over it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It would have been horrible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm continues to list the various reasons why she detests seafood-flavored Splendamin.
Which flavor do you prefer most? Spicy, salty or sour?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Just so you know, I'm not a massive fan of any of them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Spicy.
Salty.
Yeah, I'm the same as well. At the very least, it gives an umami flavor to it, which is nice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Every time I eat something salty, it just feels like it's sticking to my tongue.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: No matter how much water I drink afterward, that feeling doesn't go away. I simply detest it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: You really think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I can't say I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I just can't stand salty stuff. It always feels like it's sticking to my tongue.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: No matter how much water I drink afterward, that feeling doesn't go away. I simply detest it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I continue to talk more about the flavors we prefer.
Subordinate, do you think...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: the surface will be reclaimed one day?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Yes, I believe it will happen.
... I'm not sure.
I, too, believe that day will come.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: And when it does,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: the Admire will protect every last inch of the ocean on the surface.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... Yes, you may be right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: But I believe that no matter how hopeless things may appear, you should never give up on your dreams.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If you do, then you're just letting your nightmares come true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I have a conversation about reclaiming the surface.
Hypothetically speaking,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: IF you were to receive a large sum of money,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: how do you intend to spend it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Did you receive more donations than usual?
I'll invest in the Admire.
How can you...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Well, what would you do? I want a serious answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Not exactly the answer I was looking for...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I was hoping you'd tell me about some dream you would invest it in.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Still... Thanks for saying that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I cannot help but fantasize about hitting it big.
Do you know Ludmilla from Unlimited?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Not only are we descended from royalty, but I've also received her help once before.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's been ages since I last got in touch with her, so I'd like to give her a gift. So what do you think I should give her?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: A fancy tea set.
A fancy handkerchief.
Hm... That's not a bad idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I think she'd like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Hm... A bit ordinary, don't you think?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Oh well... If nothing else comes to mind, then I'll just go with that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Can you afford it?
I'll just... get her a gift later on, I guess.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... I purchase the gift and send it to Ludmilla on Helm's behalf.
Anchor has a bad habit of tossing starfish around whenever she's in a tough spot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'm trying to get her to kick the habit, but I'm not sure how to go about it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'll toss out all the starfish in Anchor's locker.
You can try tossing out all the starfish in Anchor's locker.
You're gonna throw them all out?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That's diabolical!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... Thank you so much.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Wait... you can't be serious?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: You actually want me to rummage through her locker for those disgusting starfish?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: No way. Ain't gonna happen!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I continue to talk about Anchor and her starfish.
The Admire features the latest cutting-edge technology...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: designed to provide our distinguished guests with the safest and most peaceful journey possible. In the past, countless ships...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Argh, I can't memorize all this!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Would it help if we recite the speech together?
Would it help if I listened to you reciting the speech?
No, it's okay.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: When the time comes, I'll be the only one reciting it anyway.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'll just keep at it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: You want to be my audience, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... That's a swell idea actually. I'll be able to memorize it more easily if it feels like the actual thing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I appreciate it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Time flies by as I watch Helm memorize her speech.
It is finally time for Helm and me to have a session,
but she is nowhere to be found.
All I could find was a lone glass box left on the floor.
Place a card containing small amounts of credit in the box.
Place one of Anchor's starfish in the box.
*Beep*
Sorry, I'm late...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm sees the glass box.
... I've only left for a moment, Subordinate. I can't believe you actually placed that in there...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Usually, it's not ethical for me to receive credits,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: but for you, I'll make an exception.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Thanks.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: *Beep*
Sorry, I'm late...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm sees the glass box.
What... is that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Subordinate... what exactly did you put in there?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Eek! Take that horrendous thing out this instant!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Helm about what constitutes a proper donation.
By the way, are you good at swimming?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'm only asking, just in case.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'm extremely good at it.
I sink like a stone.
That's great.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'd be worried if you didn't know how.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: In that case, let's head to the swimming pool.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I wanna see what you're made of.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: What?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: How can you not know how to swim when you're with Aegis?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That just won't do!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: From now on, you're undergoing special training.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Let's go to the swimming pool.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I make our way to the swimming pool.
Whenever I'm about to give an important speech, my mind will more often than not go blank.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It doesn't happen often. Just occasionally, whenever it's a particularly big or significant event.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I haven't made any major blunders yet, but I'm worried it'll happen one of these days.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's normal to flub a line or two.
Don't forget who you're representing.
For most, one misstep may not be the end of the world.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: However, it is for us.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: With how much we're struggling, one mistake may ruin us.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: So I need to hold it together.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Thanks. We may have taken a long way around, but it helped.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: You're right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: My mistakes are not just my own
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: since they'll reflect poorly on the entire Aegis.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Thanks for opening my eyes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I research different breathing techniques for relieving anxiety.
I want to test your knowledge of emergency procedures today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Let's say I fell into the water. Even after you've pulled me out, I remain unconscious.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: So the question now is, what is the first thing you should do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: There's no way you'd ever fall into the water.
I'd give you a kiss first.
Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I suppose you're right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's not an answer I was expecting to hear, but I'll accept it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... Subordinate.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's not a kiss, but CPR.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: And that's not the first thing you should do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Honestly...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: With that, Helm begins to give me first-aid training.
The Admire is always so filthy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: All this dirt and grime that builds up every day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Don't ask me why, but all it ever does is float in a swimming pool.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Perhaps, that's the reason?
I mean, people become dirty too if they don't clean themselves up.
You've got a point...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If it could sail the ocean, I'm sure it'd help with the cleanliness problem.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's a shame that it's not possible right now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Good point.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: After all, the Admire is no ordinary ship.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's also a member of Aegis.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I begin to talk about how to clean the swimming pool.
Su-Subordinate...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Jeez, Anchor threw... this right in my face.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's not a st-starfish, is it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That's a living, breathing starfish, all right.
Calm down. It's only a toy.
Th-thank you for telling me the truth.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Can you do me a favor, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Take. This. Thing. Off. Of. Me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: A-are you sure?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: *Wiggle*
I begin to examine the starfish that is stuck on Helm.
Subordinate, do you prefer a lightweight but fast ship
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: or a strong but slow ship?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: A lightweight but fast ship.
A strong but slow ship.
Hm... Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's rather different from the Admire,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: but it's a perfectly valid choice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I knew you'd say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That's just how the Admire is. It may not be the fastest ship, but it certainly has a charm to it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Yes... Just the way I like it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I spend time folding paper boats with Helm.
Suppose someone decides to sponsor you all of a sudden.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Say they give you enough money that you can lead the life you want.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: What will you do, Subordinate?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'd accept it with pleasure.
It'd be meaningless if I didn't accomplish it myself.
Exactly, why turn down a good thing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I can't help thinking...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If that's how I end up making it, will any of those achievements be truly mine?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: If I didn't accomplish something myself, have I actually done at the end of the day?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That sounds far too extreme,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: but I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: All that I've not achieved myself isn't truly mine.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: At least that's what I think.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I continue to chat more about benefactors.
How do you deal with disobedient subordinates?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: For example, let's say... drinking on the job or throwing starfish.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I don't have any subordinates like that, so I can't say.
I'd join them.
Oh...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I don't think many would...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Ya know, just go along with it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Well, I guess I'd be able to understand why they find it so enthralling.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... But I don't drink and can't touch starfish.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I discuss proper attitudes in the workplace.
Apparently, this sword I carry around bothers people, so there have been some complaints.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's not even real and is completely harmless. Nevertheless, people keep mistaking it for an actual weapon.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I can't just leave it behind, though. So I don't know what to do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's not like you can explain the situation to each and every single person you meet.
How about stabbing all passers-by?
True that...
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I can't exactly write, "Don't be scared. Not a real sword." on my back and traipse about.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: You're right. I shouldn't let it bother me so much.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Hey, that's a good idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: That'll prove it can't possibly harm anyone instantly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: It's the perfect solution... but it involves assault.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I spend time looking into different swords.
It seems that someone used the swimming pool last night.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Water had been splashed everywhere.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I don't mind people using the pool, but they should clean up after themselves.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: ... Wasn't everyone out on an mission last night?
I'll make sure it's cleaned from here on out.
If you're trying to scare me with a lame spooky story, you can give up now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I don't believe in ghosts.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I didn't expect you to say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: But I certainly won't turn down an offer like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I'll help out too, of course.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I talk about which chemicals we should use to clean the pool.
What do you think about noble causes that are doomed to fail?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Is it a meaningless feat
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: or something we should beseech everyone to do, regardless?
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Fighting for a just cause should be respected, no matter what form it takes.
If a cause is bound to fail, then it is meaningless.
That's how I feel as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Power comes in all forms, not just material or physical.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Depending on what you're fighting for, justice itself can become a form of power.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: I suppose that has an element of truth to it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: But if that's the case,
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: justice will become something reserved solely for those with power.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Meanwhile, there won't be any justice for the powerless.
adviseScripts.speaker: Helm

adviseScripts.text: Helm and I have a heated discussion about justice.
